page.title: 19CUSTOMS..TRADITIONS
page.content: It was common in Kelty, 50 or 60 years ago to give people nicknames. This custom arose because there were family names in profusion. Other people were given a nickname, because they were considered "characters" of a kind. Such nicknames were "Jimmy Peely", "Jock the Sweep", "Laughing Davie" and "Bookie Jock". The meanings of some nicknames was obvious, others had a tale to them. Most characters were held in affection, one way or another, in the village. This tradition is apparently dying out now.
